main event: On 24th August 1956 in Canton, Ohio, a round, silver object, the size of a golf ball at arm's length, was observed visually for 25 minutes. The object appeared to be stationary, had no apparent motion or sound, and looked like a bright light.
interesting points: The object was observed for three hours and 30 minutes in total, and the position of Venus at the time of the report was noted.
It was reported to be at a very high altitude, with specific wind speeds and directions provided at different altitudes.
A fighter aircraft was vectored to the area, but no results were obtained.
The report concluded that the object was unknown, with the possibility of being caused by the reflection of low clouds from the sun.
The witness was a 32-year-old male from Painsville, Ohio, a Technical Sergeant from the 3rd Detachment 2.
sighted object: a round, silver object the size of a golf ball at arm's length
witnesses: a 32-year-old male from Painsville, Ohio, a Technical Sergeant from the 3rd Detachment 2
